page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY Before 1066 Churt was a settlement which was part of the Hundred of Farnham,the manor of the Bishop of Winchester.Domesday Book tells that people had to pay rent to the Bishop at Lawday House in Blackheathfield, where they came twice a year with pigs,cows,geese,hens,grain,straw,hay, eggs,cheese,honey,horse shoes,bows, arrows. The name Churt is Saxon ,meaning "wasteland".People worked hard for very little.Later they specialised in crafts,buying and selling goods.In the Middle Ages people took their goods to the yearly fair at Farnham. David Lloyd George,who became Prime Minister,bought ,and lived in,a large house in Churt.The Pride of the Valley hotel is named after him.In the1939-45 war Canadian officers lived in Churt.
